reviewText: This may be the most poorly written or acted visual experience of my life, including church-produced Christian movies and soap operas.

Great mystery movie, but it left it unclear who is the real slasher.  The boy said he didn't know the reporter and at the beginning of the movie & throughout it made it appear that the cop was the slasher that received the boy's mom's heart.  So was the reporter the slasher or was the cop with the heart transplant the slasher.  Jensen was killed so they cannot say that they cop with the heart transplant changed because he had the heart transplant.  The reporter the boy said he didn't know him.  So we assume the reporter was the slasher.  They left it kind of unsure there at the end.  That is messed up especially no Heart of Fear II.  Love a movie that you cannot guess right away who and what right at the first five minutes, but do want to know at the ending.
If you want bad acting and dialogue, this is THE movie to see.
A class B movie, I have seen better acting on Soap Operas.  Story was predictable, I would skip forward since the acting was so poor.

Interesting movie involving a boy who has a secret about a murder he witnessed but is too traumatized to talk about it. It all finally comes out, but it takes some understanding counseling and coaching from a woman who cares.
Watch it via Amazon streaming only - I went through 2 "digitally remastered" DVDs and the quality is awful - do not purchase
Grade B acting.

Worst acted film I have seen in a long time. **SPOILER ALERT++I am seriously into watching a film, and rarely walk out or stop watching. I watched it all, and it was seriously cringeworthy--like Showgirls cringeworthy. The lead police detective is so over the top, his acting is like watching Kojak on roids, but without the lollipop. The FBI profiler lead, had full visage rocking morning, noon and night, Any more eye shimmering highlighter and she could pass as a drag queen. ("Not that there is anything wrong with that" -Seinfeld) it just seems so incredulous. Her acting is all over the map, forcing invisible tears, we are supposed to believe that an FBI profiler is going to be able to adopt the child they are protecting ( now that he is an orphan. Then there was my favorite: The FBI profiler walks into the Detective's office. It sounds like a million footsteps, then when they stop moving you can hear a few more steps. Good work Sound Person wherever you are. The twist at the end could have been great, but alas no, it introduced a new lead character and the viewer is trying to decipher what the heck is going on. This movie is a stinker. Look for something else. Cliche dialog and bad acting. Waste of time.
I liked the movie
This could have been a really great movie, but the acting left a lot to be desired. I tried getting through the entire movie, but I couldn't bring myself to finish it.

This would have been a good movie if the ACTORS could act. Don't people have any pride in doing a good job anymore.  The young man who played Taylor was the only actor in the film.  I hope this didn't stop him from getting good acting jobs.
Here's what I learned:  There are almost 350 men name Brandon Bass.  A NBA basketball player kept coming on top--Amazon has about 13 pages on him none on the actor.  Brandon  Bass the actor was in three films and a long term tv series.
Hip Hop Harry -- a children educational tv series (2006--until he aged out of part)
Heart of Fear (2006)
The McPassion (2006) with his brother Cameron Bass-- A mini movie (some kind of Christian satire) shown online March 1 - April 15, 2006.  After that only at film festivals.  A few DVDs were made for "chosen people"
Game of Life (2007) --I saw the trailer online.  You can watch the movie on Amazon Prime

The movie plot was based on a good concept, but much of it was unrealistic. I personally found the acting to be terrible. The acting and direction was so bad that at some points I found myself cringing for the actor/actress. I gave it three stars because it did hold my attention, because I needed to find out how it ended. The ending was a bit of a surprise, but again the acting ruined it. I found it to be a decent enough movie to fill a boring night, but I would not recommend it to someone who is looking to have a good movie night.

Four stars for the entertainment. I liked the FBI and Detective banterings. I thought Taylor played his part well and I liked Jack who pushed the adoption papers through for Sam to adopt Taylor. Tom came in as a reporter highly interested in the Taylor Green case. Tom is the typical psychopath--someone to be very aware of and mark every word they say, then run like the heck out of their life. Maybe the movie was too short for as many actors as there were. The movie focused mostly on Sam, then on the dectective, then on Taylor, then on Tom who was not exposed to the audience enough to make a determination of his character. Tom was very bold like a good reporter should be, but he seemed to be more than a reporter and in my opinion, his time spent in and around the police was unusual, but he was over-looked. Sam, on the other hand, gets a big fat zero for failing psychology in the real world. Even from my perspective, I could see there was something odd about Tom. He was very aggressive, especially when Sam was breaking up with him. I thought for sure she would have clued in to Tom's personality. Not the greatest detective movie, but four stars for lazy entertainment.
One of the worst acted movies with one of the poorest dialogues ever, in the history of film. I'm guessing their budget was one dollar.

The story seems lost amid evenly-spaced scenes of bare boobs and attempts to show steamy sexual encounters, none of which would detract from the overall movie if removed.  Confusing changes of locations, and literally last moment toss-in of inexplicable reasons why child reacted and a male lead was present, all could have been fleshed out more to make this a much better movie.  could have been a good flick - but someone wanted more boob view than story.

Anyone who would give more than one or two stars to this is on serious drugs.  The big plot twist comes with about seven minutes left, and then what is revealed is completely out of left field.  You would have no logical reason to come close to predicting the two reveals.  The better title is Heart of Schlock.

so bad it's funny.......acting is pitiful....Sam and his mother, please know this, I am 5'11 female and all of my bullies were short people 5'5 and shorter-  and I had to give them the business-kick their butts-[you don't recall what I am speaking of-review dialogue in beginning of movie].....also, it is creepy for mom to kiss son-Sam on lips-take a photo and then be seen naked in shower---Sam-will view film he is in----by the way, Sam was best actor in this movie......it was obvious reporter was killer but then --they shoot to cop opening closet with memorabilia----idk----it was weird---cop happens to receive organ? the entire film was ridiculous.....I have seen lead cop in many other films---worst acting here

Four stars as a parody is the only way to make sense of a movie so consistently bad at every level and element of film-making until it leaves no room on the bottom for worst films. It's biggest problem is it uses the craft of movie making in the wrong way--every decision is awful. When the male lead who only has four movies in four decades doesn't even list this one in his bio, you know it's bad. Fun can be had by identitying the errors in the acting, scenes, and script. The actors seem to be making separate movies and pasted in without any collective emotional tone. Check it out! You'll laugh and hate it!
If it wasn't for the story line, this would have received a 2 star rating from me.
the worst acting in the history of film .....corn ball script ....don't even think it
